an7.34:1.1: “Mendicants, tonight a deity … said to me:
an7.34:1.2: ‘Sir, these seven things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant trainee.
an7.34:1.4: Respect for the Teacher, for the teaching, for the Saṅgha, for the training, for immersion; being easy to admonish, and good friendship.
an7.34:1.5: These seven things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant trainee.’
an7.34:1.6: That is what that deity said.
an7.34:1.7: Then he bowed and respectfully circled me, keeping me on his right side, before vanishing right there.
an7.34:2.1: Respect for the Teacher and the teaching,
an7.34:2.2: and keen respect for the Saṅgha;
an7.34:2.4: and keen respect for the training.
an7.34:3.1: One with good friends, easy to admonish,
an7.34:3.4: and has drawn near to extinguishment.”
